Chuck_Wagon_&_the_Wheels:
{{Short description|US musical group}} {{distinguish|The Chuck Wagon Gang}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Chuck Wagon and the Wheels | image = | caption = | origin = | genre = [[Country rock]] | years_active = 2000 | label = [[Lyric Street Records|Lyric Street]] | past_members = Chuck Wagon
Carl "Cal" Pyle
Sid Sequin }} '''Chuck Wagon and the Wheels''' was an American [[country music]] group with a [[professional wrestling]] theme. It was composed of members: Carl "Cal" Pyle (background vocals), and Sid Sequin (bass guitar, vocals), pseudonyms of brothers [[Gordon Kennedy (musician)|Gordon Kennedy]], Bryan Kennedy, and Shelby Kennedy.{{Cite web|url=http://www.copyrightencyclopedia.com/chris-wood-suite-of-songs-i-fell-for-you-bill-crosby-tunes/|title=Chris Wood--Suite of songs, I fell for you, Bill Crosby tunes|website=Copyrightencyclopedia.com|accessdate=2020-03-25}} The group signed to [[Lyric Street Records]] in 2000, releasing their album ''Off the Top Rope'' that year.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p547461/biography|pure_url=yes}}|title=Chuck Wagon & the Wheels biography|last=Phares|first=Heather|website=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=2009-02-26}} It included the single "Beauty's in the Eye of the Beerholder," which peaked at 75 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country singles charts. Bryan Kennedy purchased the rights to the name Chuck Wagon and the Wheels from the founding member of the original group, Chuck W. Maultsby, in 1998.{{cite news | url=https://tucson.com/entertainment/music/wheels-reunion-benefit-concert-this-saturday/article_4f689c0f-bae2-5060-a016-c65962c948c2.html | title=Wheels reunion, benefit concert this Saturday | work=Tucson.com | agency=May 19, 2006 | accessdate=May 30, 2021}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:16em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Off the Top Rope'' | * Release date: June 13, 2000 * Label: [[Lyric Street Records]] * Formats: [[Compact disc|CD]], [[Compact cassette|cassette]] |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Single ! colspan="1"| Peak positions ! rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="60"| [[Hot Country Songs|US Country]]
